summary: This FBI 302 form documents the interview of Alfredo Rodriguez, a former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein. Rodriguez describes witnessing evidence of sexual abuse of minors at Epstein's residence and reveals his possession of a 'black book' containing contact information for numerous individuals, many of whom he claimed were underage females, which he attempted to sell for $50,000.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Former House Manager for Jeffrey Epstein, Interviewee
persons.context: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein who was interviewed by the FBI. He described witnessing naked minor females at Epstein's pool, seeing images of minors on Epstein's computer, and being tasked with cleaning sex toys. He also admitted to possessing and attempting to sell a 'black book' containing contact information for individuals, many of whom he claimed were minors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation. Rodriguez's former employer, whom Rodriguez accused of having sexual contact with minor females at his residence.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: An attorney to whom Alfredo Rodriguez attempted to sell the 'black book' and other papers for $50,000.

connections.description: Rodriguez worked as a house manager for Epstein for approximately six months between 2004 and 2005.
Rodriguez attempted to sell a 'black book' and other papers containing contact information to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000.

Rodriguez, as an employee, witnessed evidence of Epstein's alleged sexual abuse of minor females and was tasked with cleaning related items, placing him in a position of knowledge regarding the alleged crimes.

events.title: Rodriguez's Employment with Epstein
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez worked as a house manager for Jeffrey Epstein for approximately six months during this period.

events.title: FBI Interview of Alfredo Rodriguez
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez was interviewed by the FBI after waiving his Miranda rights. He provided detailed information about witnessing evidence of sexual abuse of minors at Epstein's residence and his possession of a 'black book'.

events.title: Attempted Sale of 'Black Book'
events.description: In the months prior to his FBI interview, Alfredo Rodriguez attempted to sell a 'black book' and other papers containing contact information for numerous individuals to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000.

locations: Epstein's residence (location unspecified, but referenced as 'his house' and having a pool)
Palm Beach (implied as the location of the Palm Beach Police Department)
keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Epstein's former house manager, witnessed naked minor females sunbathing at Epstein's pool and saw images of naked minor females on Epstein's computer.
Rodriguez stated he knew Epstein was having sexual contact with minor females at his house and was occasionally tasked with cleaning sex toys after the minors departed.
Rodriguez possessed a copy of a 'black book' and other papers with contact information for numerous individuals, many of whom he claimed were underage females.
Rodriguez attempted to sell these items to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000, citing financial hardship after losing his job with Epstein.
Rodriguez admitted he did not previously report this information to the FBI or other law enforcement, despite knowing of the investigation, because he was scared of Epstein.
